# Canada Border Services Agency Tender Announcement

## Request for Proposal for CCTV Installation

The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) invites tenderers to submit proposals for the installation of Closed Circuit Television (CCTV) equipment at the CBSA Coutts Port of Entry, located on Highway 4 South, Coutts, Alberta.

## Tender Details

* **Solicitation Number**: 1000418212
* **Organization Name**: CBSA Coutts Port of Entry
* **Solicitation Date**: September 1, 2023
* **Closing Date**: October 3, 2023 14:00:00
* **Anticipated Start Date**: November 1, 2023
* **Estimated Delivery Date**: February 29, 2024

## Tender Process

This tender is a competitive Request for Proposal (RFP). The procuring entity reserves the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. The Crown also retains the right to modify or cancel this tender at its sole discretion.

## Work Description

The contractor is required to install CCTV hardware at the CBSA Coutts Port of Entry. The security requirement for this project is reliability.

## Bidder Information

* **Contact Name**: Gordie Hrehirchuk
* **Phone Number**: (902) 943-1854
* **Email**: CBSA-ASFC_Solicitations-Demandes_de_soumissions@cbsa-asfc.gc.ca
* **Address**: 263 Susie Lake Crescent, Halifax, NS, B3S 0J5, Canada

## Documents

Tender documents can be found at [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca). No paper copies will be distributed. Bidders are advised to carefully review the documents and submit their proposals by the closing date.

## Important Information

* This tender is subject to the Procurement Strategy for Aboriginal Business and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
* This tender includes the installation of closed circuit television (CCTV) equipment. The selection criteria for this project are based on lowest price.
* The solicitation method for this project is competitive, and the procuring entity reserves the right to identify the Bidders to whom contracts will be awarded.
* The procuring entity is responsible for any detrimental economic and environmental effects of the project.

Please visit [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca)
